channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Melania Trump known as 'the portrait' by 'the Princess' Ivanka
item.description: Melania Trump called Ivanka Trump 'the princess' while the First Daughter referred to her as 'the portrait' - because she spoke about as much as one.

item.title: Having an underlying health condition raises the risk of dying of coronavirus by 12-FOLD
item.description: A new CDC report found that the most common pre-existing health conditions among coronavirus patients are cardiovascular disease at 32%, diabetes at 30% and lung disease at 18%.

item.title: Supreme Court rules gay and lesbian people ARE protected from being fired for their sexuality
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled Monday that a landmark civil rights law protects gay and lesbian people from discrimination in employment, a resounding victory for LGBT rights from a conservative court.

item.title: Body is found by the side of the road in Crawley as police probe 'unexplained death'
item.description: A body was discovered on the side of a road in Crawley on Monday. Sussex Police were called to an area near Southgate roundabout and Crawley Town Football Club, near the A23 at 1.05pm.

item.title: How iconic Fisher-Price toys have changed over the past century
item.description: Fisher-Price, which was founded in 1930, is celebrating 90 years. The toy company has opened its archives to show how some of its classic toys have changed designs over the decades.

item.title: Liza Minnelli DENIES reports that she has struck up a friendship with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
item.description: Liza, 74, posted a statement on Facebook on Sunday denying The Sun's claims that she is helping Prince Harry, 35, 'find his feet' in Los Angeles.

item.title: A royal surprise! Prince William video calls a mother who has been shielding with her son
item.description: Prince William, 37, spoke to mother Leanne and her five-year-old son Kaydyn, who has cystic fibrosis, at their home in Northamptonshire. The conversation will air on The One Show tomorrow.

item.title: Researchers in the Arctic Ocean map undersea methane pockets in a 250-million-year-old 'fault zone'
item.description: Researchers in the Arctic Ocean have discovered a massive network of undersea faults that have been slowly leaking methane, which may be contributing to the withdrawal of ice sheets.

item.title: Radical report to call for ban on gambling advertisements in sport
item.description: All gambling advertising in sport should be banned, according to radical proposals put forward to the Government by an influential group of MPs. A year-long inquiry has been concluded.

item.title: Jurassic World: Dominion will be the FIRST movie to resume production in the UK following COVID-19
item.description: Jurassic World: Dominion is set to resume filming in 'early-mid July' in the UK - and will be the first movie to get back to work following the COVID-19 industry shutdown.

item.title: Nadiya Hussain rejected for hand modelling job due to racism
item.description: Nadiya Hussain, 35, from Luton, revealed on Instagram that she experienced racial discrimination, while trying out as a hand model, and said the experience has stuck with her.

item.title: Trump's supporters WILL be given masks for his Tulsa rally as he claims Dems are 'Covid Shaming' him
item.description: Trump's campaign will not delay his first post-coronavirus rally, but has given into pressures from health officials and will take every attendee's temperature and pass out hand sanitizer and masks.

item.title: Nigeria-born convicted drug dealer is allowed to remain in the UK
item.description: The man, who is in 30s, was convicted of conspiring to supply cannabis seven years ago. Ministers said he should be deported. But the man said that would be 'unduly harsh' on his British family.

item.title: Princess Victoria poses for portraits with Prince Daniel on their 10th wedding anniversary
item.description: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden, 42, posed for a series of stunning portraits alongside Prince Daniel, 46, at Gustav III's pavilion at Haga, as they celebrated their 10th wedding anniversary.

item.title: Zoo in Devon to close permanently because of lockdown forcing it to rehome all its animals
item.description: Living Coasts attraction in Torquay, Devon, announced it is closing after suffering from falling visitor numbers and a forced closure due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: SpaceX invites public to apply for Starlink internet beta test
item.description: The Elon Musk-owned company is letting people who are interested in the service sign up to - in the company's words - 'Get updates on Starlink news and service availability in your area.'

item.title: Coronavirus India: Bodies pile up in Delhi hospital lobbies
item.description: Dead bodies have reportedly piled up in hospital lobbies as India's capital fast runs out of hospital beds amid a surge in coronavirus cases.

item.title: Pilot's body is found after US Air Force F-15C fighter jet crashed
item.description: The pilot of the US Air Force F15C fighter aircraft that crashed off the north-east coast of England has been found dead, RAF Lakenheath said.

item.title: 'This Is Us' writer Jas Waters battled depression for 20 years
item.description: This Is Us writer Jas Waters, 39, took her own life last week, with the LA County Coroner ruling her death a suicide by hanging. She was diagnosed with depression at age 19.

item.title: Rare breed of tame wall lizard found thriving in Kent village
item.description: Several residents in the village of Cuxton, Kent, have seen a rare species of wall lizards, usually native to the continent, living in their back gardens.

item.title: Boris Johnson says UK needs to tackle inequality rather than trying to 'rewrite the past'
item.description: Boris Johnson faced a backlash after saying the Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities would look at 'all aspects of inequality - including employment and health outcomes.

item.title: Feminist writer blasts Amazon Prime for promoting 'crass' 70s British porn films to viewers
item.description: London-born feminist Kate Smurthwaite told FEMAIL that these films routinely present sexual harassment as a 'hilarious joke' and send a negative message about appropriate behaviour.

item.title: Mystery deaths of 154 'intact' elephants in Botswana
item.description: The southern African country is home to a third of the continent's elephants and grew a population of 80,000 to 130,000 because of well-managed reserves. But they are still under threat.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Shops reopen for first time in three months
item.description: Stores including Zara, John Lewis and Debenhams have slashed prices by as much as 70 per cent in a bid to lure shoppers back.

item.title: Country singer Hank Williams Jr's daughter shares heartache over sister Katherine's car crash death
item.description: Katherine Williams-Dunning was killed when her SUV crashed in Tennessee on Saturday. Her sister, Holly Audrey Williams, expressed her shock in an Instagram post on Sunday.

item.title: Vietnam pair arrested for poisoning pet dogs and cats for meat
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Stunned residents woke on Sunday to find their beloved dogs and cats scattered across the main street of the Nhu Xuan District of Thanh Hoa Province.

item.title: Pictured: Far-right statue defender surrounded by baying mob - moments before he was rescued
item.description: The man, whose 'life was in danger', can be seen raising his hand to demonstrators before getting dragged into the mob near Waterloo Station, central London, on Saturday.

item.title: Grotesque models show how sedentary lifestyle affects health
item.description: Researchers from onlinegambling.com compiled data from various studies on how a sedentary and indoor lifestyle impacts the human body.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Robert Jenrick raises hopes of summer weddings
item.description: Housing and Communities Secretary Robert Jenrick has told MPs the government will allow summer weddings 'as soon as we can' it follows the reopening of places of worship earlier today.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 41,736 with 38 new fatalities
item.description: Department of Health bosses are yet to confirm the total deaths across all settings. If 32, it is a 71 per cent drop since Monday two weeks ago, when 111 deaths were officially recorded.

item.title: Priti Patel slams far right 'thugs' over 'utterly indefensible hooliganism' in London
item.description: The Home Secretary told the Commons she gave police her 'full backing' to tackle yobs responsible for violence scenes in Westminster on Saturday.

item.title: Solar Orbiter prepares to capture closest image of the Sun
item.description: The UK-built satellite came within 47 million miles of its surface on Monday and will take a picture this week, but it won't be ready until July, researchers say.

item.title: Secondary schools pupils facing GCSE and A-level exams return today
item.description: Around one in five British pupils have carried out no schoolwork, or less than an hour a day, since schools closed partially in March.

item.title: Tory peer says targeting of Sir Winston Churchill's statue echoes 'fascist days of Islamic State'
item.description: Tory Lord Marlesford said the decision to board up Sir Winston Churchill's statue was raising the 'banner of anarchy' in Parliament Square and was similar to the days of Islamic State in Syria.

item.title: Domino's launches a vegan range after revealing their first dough 'wasn't up to scratch'
item.description: The chain is trialling two new vegan friendly recipes in 46 stores across the UK and Republic of Ireland from today. It trialled a vegan dough two years ago, but admitted it wasn't 'up to scratch'.

item.title: Robert Jenrick insists he acted in 'good faith' by approving Tory donor's £1bn flat development
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick is facing continuing pressure after approving a planning application by billionaire Richard Desmond for 1,500 luxury flats in east London.

item.title: Who needs a sheepdog? Hilarious moment baby raccoon called The Governor herds goats into their pen
item.description: The raccoon called The Governor was rescued by Ryan Kadyk in Sarver, Pennsylvania. The Governor has a lot of fun playing with the goats on the farm he lives on.

item.title: Kate and Gerry McCann 'could be told within days how Madeleine died'
item.description: German detectives say they have one piece of evidence that proves Madeleine died after she vanished. The family's lawyer, Rogerio Alves, will meet them within days to find out more.

item.title: EasyJet resumes flying with COVID-19 measures in place
item.description: The first flight, from London Gatwick to Glasgow, left at 6.53am for a scheduled arrival in Scotland of 8.30am, as the airline resumes a minimal service mainly between cities within Britain.

item.title: Man charged with the 2001 robbery and murder of woman, 86
item.description: A man has been charged with robbery and manslaughter after 86-year-old Hilda Lockert was attacked on her doorstep 19 years ago. She died two weeks later on her birthday on May 15, 2001.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Review of two-metre rule will take 'weeks'
item.description: No10 played down the chances of a swift change despite warnings millions of jobs are at risk, refusing even to guarantee that it will come before pubs and restaurants are slated to open on July 4.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain to open its borders from 21 June
item.description: Border controls will be lifted for EU member states from Sunday - and the Spanish foreign ministry has confirmed that this includes transition-period Britain.

item.title: 18-year-old identical triplets look so similar it's impossible to tell them apart
item.description: Sam, Fay and Mel van Wely, 18, from Nijmegen, in the Netherlands, are identical triplets who are so similar, they sometimes struggle to tell each other apart, and have to dress in different colours.

item.title: Compulsory face coverings and widespread coronavirus testing and tracing could save 50,000 LIVES
item.description: A team of experts investigated 31 different scenarios for capping the UK death toll. They found the most successful strategy involved making face coverings compulsory.

item.title: Europe´s borders reopen for `summer unlike any other´
item.description: Motorists were queuing to enter France from Italy and Germany from Denmark this morning after emergency checks were lifted overnight.

item.title: Mother horrified after mysterious hornet-like insect with giant 'stinger' is found in their garden
item.description: A giant wasp-like insect was discovered by Samantha, Stoneley, 28, after it fell out of the sky and landed dead in her back garden. Experts believe it to be a harmless wood wasp.

item.title: Coronavirus levels in the brain surge by TEN-FOLD within three days of infection, study suggests
item.description: A new study from Johns Hopkins University found that within three days, the number of copies in the human brain models of the novel coronavirus was 10 times greater than it had been at the start.

item.title: Norway will delete all data through its now-suspended coronavirus track and trace app
item.description: Health authorities said on Monday they had suspended Smittestopp ('Infection stop') which was set to collect movement data to trace the spread of COVID-19.

item.title: The jaw-dropping images that have wowed the judges in the annual Moscow International Foto Awards
item.description: The annual Moscow International Foto Awards is now in its seventh year and has been flooded with entries from photographers in over 100 countries.

item.title: Princess Sofia of Sweden celebrates her fifth wedding anniversary to Prince Carl Philip
item.description: Princess Sofia of Sweden, 35, celebrated her fifth wedding anniversary over the weekend, and shared a collection of photographs from her big day to Instagram to mark the occasion.

item.title: Far-right thug who kicked police sergeant during BLM protests caught thanks to luminous green shorts
item.description: Far-right thug Daniel Allan, 35, from Sunderland, kicked police sergeant Richard Lambert to the ground next to Big Ben during the Black Lives Matter counter-protest in London on Saturday.

item.title: Boris Johnson holds crunch summit with EU chief Ursula von der Leyen
item.description: After holding a virtual summit, the leaders confirmed that the transition will end in December, and declared talks will be 'intensified' in July in a desperate bid to break the deadlock.

item.title: TikTok video reveals why you've been filling ice cube trays wrong your entire life
item.description: Vlogger 'Brittnaenae' showed that water should be poured onto the flat spots separating the grooves to allow it to trickle down gently into the surrounding sections without overflowing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Minnesota cases fall despite George Floyd protests
item.description: Early coronavirus testing for George Floyd protesters in Minnesota is showing that one in 70 Black Lives Matter protesters have tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Thousands of Tube, bus and train passengers in England MUST wear a face-covering from today
item.description: Strict new laws regarding face coverings on public transport come into play in England today - with 3,000 extra staff, including police officer, being brought in to enforce the rules.

item.title: New pet food claims to reduce allergens after study shows it is their SPIT that causes the sniffles
item.description: Scientists working for pet food firm Purina spent a decade studying the causes of cat allergies and found it was cat saliva on the fur that causes the sniffles.

item.title: Covid-19 patients keep immune system antibodies for at least two MONTHS
item.description: Research by St George's University in London and the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine studied 177 people and found that antibodies remained in the blood for at least two months after infection.

item.title: New 3D-printed AirShield device for plane cabins revealed in fight against coronavirus
item.description: The firm behind it, Seattle-based Teague, says that AirShield is 'a germ isolation system that provides an effective additional line of defence against viral transmission in the cabin'.

item.title: Wealthy villagers club together to buy £100k empty field in bid to stop massive traveller site
item.description: Villagers in leafy Eton Wick, Berkshire, were spooked when a digger began churning up Crown Farm ahead of its auction this week.

item.title: Dozens more migrants are caught crossing the English Channel
item.description: Around 70 refugees were taken into the Port of Dover today following a rescue mission involving the Border Force vessels Hunter and Seeker.

item.title: British firm fires a 6.5ft-long rocket 20,000ft into the air from Shetland
item.description: A 6.5ft (2m) rocket called Skylark Nano blasted off from Fethaland Peninsula on the mainland of Shetland and reached an altitude of around 20,000 ft (6km).

item.title: PM REJECTS Marcus Rashford's plea to extend free school meals
item.description: The Prime Minister will instead write to the Manchester United and England striker about what the Government is doing to make sure vulnerable children do not go hungry.

item.title: Oskar Schindler's wife Emilie felt 'cut out' of history
item.description: Oskar Schindler's wife Emilie, who played a '50/50' role in saving the Jews, was mistaken for one of the people her husband had saved by Steven Spielberg, reveals new recordings up for sale.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Oxford Street comes to life after lockdown
item.description: Shoppers desperate to hit the high street rushed to Regent Street and Oxford Street today to form socially distanced queues outside stores which had been deserted for months.

item.title: Couple who never planned to have any children have revealed they now have a huge brood of ELEVEN
item.description: Joseph Sutton, 35, and wife Nicole, 30, live with their eight daughters and three sons in their three bedroom home in Cumbria, and admit they often attract stares when they go out as a family.

item.title: Spooky moment police find 'haunted' outdoor gym equipment moving by itself in the middle of night
item.description: Spooky footage shows uniformed officers standing around the gym equipment in Kashiram Park, in Jhansi, Uttar Pradesh, India, on June 11.

item.title: Any form of healthy eating can lower risk of heart disease, study says
item.description: Any form of healthy eating over several decades can lower the risk of heart disease, according to a new study in the US using data collected over the course of 30 years.

item.title: Iranian teen bride who fled days after her wedding to cousin is beheaded by jilted husband
item.description: The 19-year-old bride was found beheaded in Abadan, southwestern Iran, after her husband, 23, handed himself into police claiming he had decapitated her body due to infidelity.

item.title: Green glow similar to the Aurora Borealis is detected around Mars for the first time
item.description: So-called 'green line emissions' - caused by the excitation of oxygen in the atmosphere - are responsible for the primary colour of the polar aurorae on Earth.

item.title: Femail reveals the best sales deals as shops open
item.description: Stores including Zara, John Lewis and Debenhams have slashed prices by as much as 70 per cent in a bid to lure shoppers back and we have found the very best deals on offer.

item.title: PG Wodehouse's former Mayfair home on sale for £2.25m
item.description: An apartment in a grand Neo-Baroque blue-plaque Mayfair house, formerly a Royal residence of Alexander Mountbatten, 1st Marquess of Carisbrooke, has gone on sale for £2.25 million.

item.title: 'Princess Diana's favourite' London restaurant Le Caprice will not reopen
item.description: Le Caprice, in Piccadilly, London, described as Princess Diana's 'favourite', is now permanently closed after shutting its doors when lockdown was announced.

item.title: Builders' merchant Travis Perkins will slash 2,500 jobs and close 165 stores
item.description: The UK company, which also owns Toolstation and Wickes, said the decision comes as it expects the recession to hit the trade for at least two years.

item.title: Mansion that once hosted Henry VII sells for £1.3MILLION despite its crumbling walls
item.description: Troy House in Monmouthshire was built in the 17th century for the family of the Duke of Beaufort. It went up for auction with a £200,000 guide price and sold for six times the amount.

item.title: Hundreds of petrol-heads snub social-distancing to watch souped-up motors
item.description: Flash cars drove through the area in Alwoodley, Leeds, on Saturday night, with residents complaining to West Yorkshire police.

item.title: Flying quad: Thieves hurl a QUAD BIKE at police car from the back of a van during high-speed chase
item.description: Officers from the Derbyshire force were forced to swerve around the off-road vehicle in Grindleford. The yobs also threw a hammer at the police car which struck the windscreen

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Reverend wears face shield as churches reopen
item.description: Places of worship across the UK reopened for private prayer on Monday with worshipers sat in socially-distanced pews and clergymen wearing personal protective equipment.

item.title: Taoiseach Leo Varadkar is set to hand reins over to Fianna Fail
item.description: The deal is expected to make Fianna Fail leader Micheál Martin prime minister in the first half of the government's five-year term before Fine Gael leader Leo Varadkar returns in 2022.

item.title: Edited photos imagine what the royals might look like as the opposite sex
item.description: Instagram account @dianafanatic, which is run by a Spanish user, used smartphone app FaceApp to morph the faces of royals including Prince William and Kate Middleton.

item.title: Social influencer slammed for exercising near religious ceremony on Bali beach
item.description: Footage capturing the two extremes on the Indonesian island hotspot has gone viral and sparked online outrage since being shared to social media

item.title: Woman awarded £4k after boss frowned on antenatal check
item.description: A pregnant finance analyst was awarded £4,000 after her boss at London firm QBE Management Services told her she was 'letting the team down' by attending an antenatal appointment.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Portuguese police prepare to search wells
item.description: A single-storey farmhouse in Praia da Luz the prime suspect rented is less than half an hour away from where the three-year-old disappeared in 2007.

item.title: Martin Lewis reveals how to save money in five minutes
item.description: Money Saving Expert Martin Lewis, 48, from London, revealed how to save money in five minutes by discovering hidden payments being taken from debit and credit accounts on This Morning.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could HEATING protect against infection?
item.description: Scientists advising the Government said there is 'moderate' evidence the virus struggles to survive on surfaces indoors when the heat is high compared to when it is low.

item.title: Flu jabs for everyone could protect NHS from second wave of Covid-19
item.description: Health officials in the UK are considering offering free flu jabs to everyone - they are normally restricted to the very old, very young, and pregnant - to take pressure off the NHS this winter.

item.title: Joe Wicks is stopping his daily PE lessons after 13 weeks
item.description: Joe Wicks has revealed he's cutting back on his online P.E. lessons, which have gained millions of fans during lockdown.

item.title: Biomass plants £13 billion subsidy 'should be reviewed'
item.description: Climate change think-tank Ember said subsidies should encourage biomass power plants to invest in carbon capture and storage. (Left: Drax biomass power plant in North Yorkshire)

item.title: A THIRD of 'clinically vulnerable' people admit they did not stick to shielding advice
item.description: A survey by the Office for National Statistics showed that 33 per cent of people said they 'mostly', but not entirely, followed the advice and 49 per cent said they had left their home at some point.

item.title: Racist thugs makes monkey gestures at London BLM protesters
item.description: Vile footage shows the thug goading anti-racism campaigners in Trafalgar Square, which on Saturday saw ugly clashes between far-right and BLM supporters.

item.title: Drunk woman, 29, cracks plane window mid-flight over China
item.description: The 29-year-old passenger had drunk two bottles of super-strength spirits on her own due to emotional stress before boarding the domestic flight in China, according to police. She has been detained.

item.title: Could these be the worst Photoshop fails EVER?
item.description: People from across the globe have shared the worst Photoshop fails they've spotted online. The snaps, which have been collated by Bored Panda, include dodgy copy and paste jobs.

item.title: Moment woman is arrested after 'stabbing Joe Jackson's granddaughter and hurling the n-word at her'
item.description: Footage taken in the aftermath of the alleged attack on May 30 in Las Vegas, main shows as Angela Bonell, 22, is led away by cops as Yasmine Jackson sits with her face slashed, inset.

item.title: London braces for chaos as hooligans and far-right thugs threaten clashes with BLM protesters
item.description: Police chiefs imposed the 5pm curfew in a bid to quell the unrest seen throughout the day as the anti-racist rally and a pro-statue counter-protest descended into hooliganism in London.

item.title: Comedian Celeste Barber shares hilarious snaps of her efforts to parody celebrity's sexy snaps
item.description: Celeste Barber, 38, from Australia, who is known for recreating celebrity photos boasts over 7 million followers on Instagram. She mocked stars including Rihanna in a series of new snaps.

item.title: Alleged iPhone 12 leak reveals square edges like the iPad Pro
item.description: An alleged leak of Apple's upcoming iPhone 12 suggests the device will have flat-edges like the iPad Pro and early iPhone models.

item.title: Lout, 28, admits to outraging public decency after urinating near memorial to PC Keith Palmer
item.description: Andrew Banks, of Stansted, Essex, was charged with outraging public decency by police on Sunday night.

item.title: Churchill's picture disappeared from Google's search results two months ago
item.description: The company's automatic system had previously picked a photo of Churchill as a younger man but it was deemed not representative of how he was known. A system bug failed to upload a new one.

item.title: Hollyoaks' Lysette Anthony quits Twitter amid Hollyoaks row
item.description: The Hollyoaks star has quit Twitter after facing backlash amid the show's racism row.

item.title: Rabbit-breeder reveals she decided to keep adorable bunny born with no EARS as a pet
item.description: Little Leo the bunny was the only one of his eight siblings to enter the world without his trademark floppy ears. Breeder Kylie Clarke, from Belfast, decided to keep him as a pet for her four kids.

item.title: More than 30 intelligent alien races could be living in our galaxy
item.description: Astronomers calculated that the at least 100 billion-star Milky Way could harbour 36 civilisations. Their estimate was based on the idea that technological life takes 5 billion years to develop.

item.title: Horrifying moment a woman's limbs are cut out of a crocodile's stomach
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: The beast pounced on Fatimah, 45, while she was fishing in a river in North Kalimantan, Indonesia, last Friday night.

item.title: Boy has a lucky escape when huge bucket of water smashes through the roof inches from his chair
item.description: Shocking footage shows a young boy luckily escape after the roof collapses and the room is flooded with water while he is playing a computer game in Ben Tre, Vietnam.

item.title: Daredevils dodge lava bombs while crossing an active volcano on a tightrope to set world record
item.description: Alexander Schulz, 28 and Rafael Bridi, 33, crossed the crater of the Yasur volcano on Tanna Island, in the southwestern Pacific Ocean - walking on a one inch wide strip of webbing.

item.title: Grizzly bear super-mom gives birth to her 17th cub
item.description: In the wild grizzly bear sows don't live long past 26 years, but 24-year-old Bear 399 who lives at Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming has just produced a new litter.

item.title: Australian state premier threatens tougher punishments after Captain Cook statue vandalism
item.description: Gladys Berejiklian, the premier of New South Wales, called the vandalism 'un-Australian' and said 'the vast majority of us don't condone it'.

item.title: Moment paraglider is chased down and arrested on beach after 'taunting' police
item.description: Paul Satchell, 56, filmed himself sobbing as he was arrested in Bexhill-On-Sea, East Sussex on April 26 before lockdown restrictions were relaxed.

item.title: Half of Earth's ice-free land remains unaltered by humans
item.description: About half of Earth's ice-free land remains unaltered by humans and can still be protected with swift conservation measures, a new study shows.

item.title: Forty rival tribes battle to outdo each other's terrifying appearance at Papua New Guinea festival
item.description: Images show the Chimbu tribesmen covered in black and white skeleton paint and the Asaro tribe, also known as Mudmen, who dress up in mud. They were taken in Paiya village in Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Donald Trump's niece has written 'harrowing and salacious book' confirming she leaked his tax return
item.description: Mary Trump, 55, has written a book entitled Too Much And Never Enough, lifting the lid on the president's family. The book will be published in August, months before the election, and is 'salacious'.

item.title: Stomach-churning footage shows doctor remove a PURPLE cyst of 'Camembert-like goo' from man's scalp
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Footage shows Dr Ross Perry, the medical director of Cosmedics skin clinics in London, squeezing the pillar cyst out of a man's heas.

item.title: 'Iron Lady' marathon runner, 33, dies after rescuers took 11 hours to find her during 42-mile race
item.description: Kateryna Katiushcheva, 33, collapsed during a gruelling 42-mile event in southern Ukraine. The runner was in 'grave' condition when she was found six miles from the finishing line.

item.title: Second coronavirus vaccine in Britain to start human trials WEDNESDAY and doses could cost just £3
item.description: Scientists at Imperial College London hope to get approval to start their human trials today and say that the first doses will be given on Wednesday after participants have had health checks.

item.title: Former beauty queen who suffered 85 per cent burns poses for naked portrait
item.description: Carol Mayer, 53, from Cairns, was captured by London-native Brian Cassey, an award-winning photographer working across Australasia, who was struck by her 'startling blue eyes'.

item.title: The Duchess of Cornwall calls flowers 'nature's healers in these difficult times'
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall has heralded the power of flowers to 'lift our spirits' as she took part in an initiative to support British Flowers Week.

item.title: How to make Ascot's afternoon tea at home
item.description: As this year's events will take place behind closed doors amid the coronavirus pandemic, Ascot's Head Chef Ben Dutson and Executive Chef, Gemma Amor share their recipes.

item.title: Mail on Sunday launches petition over Winston Churchill statue
item.description: The Mail is calling on our readers to help block any attempt to remove the statue of Sir Winston Churchill from outside the Houses of Parliament.

item.title: Women are more likely than men to lie to their bosses when working from home
item.description: A study by the University of Cologne set out to discover how likely people are to be dishonest over different types of communication - from email to face to face.

item.title: Woolly jumper! Adorable little girl giggles with delight as she gets her SHEEP to leap over a pole
item.description: Verity Seignot-Griffiths from Bordon, East Hampshire, confidently leads Hugo over a pole. The two-year-old giggles with delight as she runs around the field with Hugo in tow.

item.title: Homeschooling stress fuels surge in anxiety during lockdown with married couples the worst affected
item.description: People in marriages or civil partnerships who have reported they are suffering from 'high' levels of anxiety doubled in the first month of Britain's shutdown.

item.title: India Willoughby says UK needs 'sexit' amid JK Rowling 'transphobia' row
item.description: India Willoughby, 53, London, told on GMB, the LGBTQ community in the UK should have a 'sexit', where those diagnosed with gender dysphoria are separated from those who identify as another gender.

item.title: Bus driver chases off mugger after spotting him trying to snatch elderly woman's bag on the street
item.description: Károly Zsolt Kis was driving by Újgyőr market in Miskolc, Hungary, when he spotted a woman with a walking stick who was being attacked.

item.title: Woman who was mistaken for her husband's sister because she was overweight
item.description: Ashley Strachan, 35, from North Lanarkshire, told FEMAIL how she hid behind her bubbly personality when strangers made the personal comments about her size, but that deep down it hurt.

item.title: As changing rooms are closed, a stylist reveals the most effective ways to shop post-Covid
item.description: Award-winning stylist Susie Hasler told Femail how to navigate the shops when changing rooms are closed, by planning what to buy and working out the size you need before you even leave the house.

item.title: Police seek masked woman suspected of burning Wendy's in Atlanta amid Rayshard Brooks protests
item.description: Atlanta police seek a masked white woman suspected of burning down Wendy's. Crime Stoppers are offering a $10,000 reward for her arrest and indictment of those responsible for the fire.

item.title: A 15,000-strong crowd march for Black Lives Matter in Brighton
item.description: More than 1,000 protesters gathered in Brighton to stand in solidarity with BLM demonstrations worldwide. Crowds gathered in dozens of UK towns and cities.
